item.title: 10 Best Open-World Games With Realistic Ways To Fast Travel
item.description:
While there is no doubt that it can make getting to specific locations much quicker, fast travel can easily break the immersion of an open-world, especially when it's as simple as opening the map and immediately teleporting to a location. When games implement realistic ways to fast travel , it becomes much easier to believe the world that the developers have worked hard to create.

This list includes some of the best open-world games that discard the all-too-easy ways to fast travel in favor of offering players more logical ways to traverse. Some even have cutscenes or are more convoluted to do, encouraging players to slow down and explore rather than getting caught in the trap of speedily plowing through the game.

10 The Elder Scrolls 3: Morrowind

The Franchise Stepping Into Its Own

The third main game in The Elder Scrolls series, Morrowind, is set in Vvardenfell, where Gods and fantasy races struggle for power. In terms of RPGs, Morrowind is relatively harder to get into, with no quest markers or stat regeneration, but it has a lot of lore and amazing world-building.

Unlike the TES games that followed, Morrowind did not make fast traveling straightforward, but the options players do have are innovative and make sense within the world. They can ride silt striders and boats, use teleportation magic, and seek assistance from Guild guides . These methods all take different routes, so players also have to think about the best way to reach their destination.

9 Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood

Still A Fantastic Game Over A Decade Later

Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood is a sequel to the second game, and the second game in the Ezio Trilogy. The player continues to try and free Rome from the Borgia's control and reclaim the Apple of Eden from the Templars, all while rebuilding both the city and the Brotherhood.

A fair amount of the optional content revolves around restoring Rome, from repairing aqueducts to buying landmarks to opening shops. In order to fast travel between districts, the player must unlock tunnels to use ; if the tunnel is not purchased for a particular district, they won't be able to use it. Fortunately, the franchise is known for its fun free-running mechanics.

This tunnel system is also used in Revelations . Other Assassin's Creed titles have different ways to fast travel (such as boats and travel stations), but for the sake of variety, only one has been included.

8 Grand Theft Auto Online

Players Can Cause As Much Or As Little Chaos As They Like

As many players await the long-anticipated release of Grand Theft Auto 6 , many continue to enjoy the open worlds of the previous titles. Like GTA5' s story mode, Grand Theft Auto Online takes place in the LA-inspired Los Santos. As a multiplayer sandbox, there is plenty of mischief to be had, whether it's racing, stealing, or gambling.

There are plenty of both regular and over-the-top ways to get around in GTAO , on land and water, and in the sky. By hailing or using the in-game mobile phone to call a taxi , players can jump in, choose a location, and select "Trip Skip" - a much more interactive way to fast travel.

7 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

One Of The Most Iconic RPGs

By now, Skyrim has been thoroughly rinsed by most gamers for its memorable world and character creation possibilities. Although the game does make it incredibly easy to fast travel, with players being able to travel to any discovered location from pretty much anywhere, there are other, more immersive ways.

Using carriages near each city's stables allows the player to get a ride to any of the other cities, regardless of whether they've been there before or not. It's a great method to use when roleplaying as a traveling merchant or weary warrior. Players will also need to take a boat ride to get to Solstheim if they have the Dragonborn DLC.

6 Fallout 4

The Sole Survivor And Dogmeat Against What's Left Of The World

The fourth main game in the iconic post-apocalyptic series, Fallout 4 follows the Sole Survivor's journey through America's divided wastelands to find their son, with plenty of fighting, crafting, leveling, and base-building in between. Outside of Survival Difficulty, players can fast travel to known locations via the map, though there are more immersive ways to get around.

Throwing a vertibird signal grenade in Fallout 4 will summon the US-developed military aircraft, the vertibird, for the player to ride. By choosing a place on the map, the vertibird will take them as close as possible, and, as an added bonus, will help fend off enemies if it lands near hostiles.

5 Marvel's Spider-Man

Smooth And Satisfying Gameplay

Marvel's Spider-Man follows the iconic Peter Parker as he faces notorious villains such as Doctor Octopus and Electro to save New York. The game is most renowned for its addictive web swinging and combat, with gameplay feeling as if it has weight and momentum, making traveling all the more fun.

For players wanting a quicker way to get around, they only have to open the map and select an already-discovered location. However, the game includes a cutscene of Spider-Man riding the subway . Not only does this add to the realism and remind players of Parker's normality, it's also a humorous change of pace from swinging through the city.

Fast travel is only unlocked after completing the "Wheels Within Wheels" main story quest.

4 Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

One Of The Most Authentic And Immersive Games Of The 2020s

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is one of the bigger indie games to come out of 2025, and will no doubt be nominated for many Game of the Year awards. Its in-depth mechanics and RPG elements, historical accuracies, and charismatic characters all combine into an engrossing experience.

Fast travel is possible in KCD2, though not without its risks and, unlike most games, it's not instantaneous. The player can see Henry's journey and the passing of time on the map, and on the way, they may encounter random events . This could be anything from bandits to campsites; players can stop off at (or take a chance at running from) these points along the way if they choose.

3 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Slay Monsters And Save The World

The Witcher 3 likely needs no introduction, being part of a franchise that also includes books and series, and one of the best-selling RPGs of all time. Players must fight monsters and people to save both Ciri and the world from the Wild Hunt's invasion, amid an already war-torn Continent.

Players can fast travel within and between kingdoms using discovered signposts , but one of the more realistic ways is sailing . When aboard a boat, players can choose an anchor-marked dock to fast travel to. Using this method adds a bit more limitation, which also contributes to the role-playing potential - just imagine Geralt, the legendary monster-hunting sailor.

2 Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain

Nails The Open-World Elements

As open-world games go, Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain is among the best when it comes to size, amount of content, and gameplay, and the franchise's first real venture into the genre doesn't compromise the classic Metal Gear vibes. The title follows Snake as he navigates a warring Afghanistan, with an overarching plot about revenge, and plenty of missions that can be approached however the player chooses.

MGS5 has one of the most unique fast travel systems. Players have to hide under a box in a loading zone in order for a truck to pick them up. The trucks can transport Snake to any other delivery points, provided they have been unlocked by collecting their respective invoice.

1 Red Dead Redemption 2

Be An Honorable Vigilante Or Lawless Murderer

Red Dead Redemption 2 is one of Rockstar's biggest achievements to date. The game follows the outlaw Arthur Morgan and his rogue family, the Van Der Linde gang, as they attempt to escape the law and find the funds to hang up their guns for good. From a narrative standpoint, RDR2 excels, which is only enhanced by the realistic physics and visuals of the game.

Red Dead Redemption 2 is, admittedly, slower-paced than a lot of open-world games that are keen to throw the player into the wild and explore, but for patient gamers, this is a great opportunity to fully indulge in the world. There are various stage-coaches and train stations across the map that can be used to fast travel between places, requiring the player to go through the whole works of buying a ticket and watching a cutscene. While not the fastest of fast travel, it's one of the most cinematic and era-appropriate.

Players can also fast travel from camps, provided Dutch's lodging is upgraded.

item.title: InZOI: How to Refurbish Furniture
item.description:
InZOI players can create lively cities and fully customize Zois as they play with various lifestyles and experiences. The life simulation brings its own flare to the genre with realistic graphics and attention to detail in its gameplay.

A subtle touch of realism from InZOI's Story Mode is furniture and how it gets dirty or wears down over time. Players will notice their furniture pieces getting tears or scuffs, but they don't necessarily have to replace them when this happens. Instead, they can save money by Refurbishing furniture.

How to Refurbish Furniture in InZOI

Players have a lot of creative freedom and control when building in InZOI . Under each furniture category, various pieces can be customized with textures and a color wheel, allowing players to create unique and cohesive furniture sets.

They can also use an AI feature to generate new textures or use the 3D printer to create objects using photos. After players decorate and live in their builds, furniture gets dirty and deteriorates. A messy environment can cause Zois to feel Uncomfortable or even get sick.

Objects that Zois use regularly deteriorate faster.

Zois can clean their houses to slow the process down, but eventually, things wear and tear. This is due to a gameplay feature connected to the Housework skill.

Players can increase their Zoi's Housework skill by doing the following:

  • Washing dishes
  • Doing laundry
  • Vacuuming
  • Cleaning Bathtubs
  • Repairing Broken Objects
  • Wiping Tables

When Zois reach Housework level two, they can Refurbish objects to increase their skill. Additionally, the only way to fix deteriorating objects is to Refurbish them. To Refurbish an object, click on it and scroll down to the Refurbish interaction. Zois must pay Meows to Refurbish an object, and the price varies depending on the item and the extent of damage.

There is a Money Cheat in the tutorial book if players are short on Meows.

Zois can Refurbish counters, cabinets, beds, and couches. Certain chairs and tables will show signs of deterioration but don't have a Refurbishment option. Players must replace these items in Build Mode or by visiting the Furniture Store.

Other Ways to Increase Houseworking Skill

Zois can also practice Housework using the Furniture Workbench and 3D Printer, which can be purchased in Build Mode. A common bug causes players to get stuck when using the Workbench, but they can Emergency Rescue their Zois from the tutorial book. Then, players should reload the game to reset it.

Zois that are Uncomfortable have a hard time with chores and may refuse to do them or take longer to finish. Zois can also have Traits or Values that make household work more manageable. Those with the Safety Value will enjoy cleaning, may enter a Concentrated or Tranquil mood, and get a boost to their skill gain.

item.title: FFXIV: All Custom Deliveries Quest Guide
item.description:
There are a variety of different ways to make the most of crafting and gathering in Final Fantasy XIV , as the fruits of your labor can lead to some truly enticing rewards. As the game continues to add more content for Eorzea's ambitious artisans, there are certain niches that stand out above the rest.

One of those niches in Final Fantasy 14 is Custom Deliveries, which to date is one of the game's most popular avenues for leveling such jobs without being stuck at the grindstone for hours, literally. If you want to take a crack at some of them, then you'll need to know where to find them.

What Are Custom Deliveries in FFXIV?

Custom Deliveries are special crafting and gathering questlines helmed by certain NPCs throughout each expansion that provide numerous benefits to players. Not only do they give copious amounts of leveling experience to whichever crafter or gatherer you choose along with crafting/gathering Scrips , but there are also various enticing material rewards to collect for your efforts, from mounts to glamours.

These questlines involve acquiring different collectable-type goods requested by the respective NPC client during any given week. Again, they can be crafted or gathered with any qualifying job you have, as long as that job meets the minimum level requirement. Collectables are a unique type of item with their own system of procurement that involves using special abilities to manifest the highest quality of that item possible. The higher its quality score, the greater the rewards you'll receive in return.

To unlock the ability to gather Collectables in the game, you first need to complete the 'Inscrutable Tastes' Level 50 quest, which you pick up from Morgayne in Isghard's Foundation at (X:10.1, Y:10.4). This will also lead you to other quests that allow you to unlock Scrip Exchange points in subsequent expansions, starting with Idyllshire in Heavensward . You will also need them to unlock access to these Custom Delivery clients by unlocking that expansion's inventory of special collectible items.

The quests you need include the following:

  • Inscrutable Tastes (Level 50) - Morgayne in Foundation (X:10.1, Y:10.4)
  • No Longer a Collectable (Level 56) - Lydirlona in Mor Dhona (X:22.3, Y:6.8)
  • Go West, Craftsman (Level 60) - Lydirlona in Mor Dhona (X:22.3, Y:6.8)
  • Reach Long and Prosper (Level 60) - Galiena in Rhalgr's Reach (X:9.8, Y:12.5)
  • The Boutique Always Winds (Level 70) - Mowen in Eulmore (X:11.4, Y:10.7)
  • Expanding House of Splendors (Level 80) - Ofpilona in Radz-at-Han (X:11.7, Y:9.6)
  • Dawn of a New Deal (Level 90) - Rhodina in Solution Nine (X:9.2, Y:13.4)

Each week, the NPC client will ask for different items, which will vary depending on the job. The more collectable items you bring them, your reputation with them will improve via a Satisfaction Gauge. Once it reaches a certain threshold, you'll gain a new level of trust with the client and more opportunities to acquire different items for them.

Once you reach the final stage of their Satisfaction Gauge, you'll usually receive a grand reward for all your efforts, such as a mount or a full glamour set. What's more, they'll often give you permission to dress them in a glamour of your choosing for future deliveries.

All Custom Deliveries Locations in FFXIV (How to Unlock)

With Dawntrail 's latest Patch 7.2 update, there are currently 11 different Custom Delivery clients that you can work with, across all expansions from Heavensward up to Dawntrail . Each client has their own requirements for participating in their questlines, so make sure your character is properly leveled and equipped before seeking them out. You may also need to reach a certain point in the respective expansion's MSQ (Main Scenario Questline) before they become accessible.

Remember, unlike Allied Society questlines (aka "Beast Tribes"), which can span across all job types in the game, Custom Deliveries are exclusively for crafters and gatherers.

Custom Delivery Client Name

Location

Min. Level Requirement

Starting Quest

Prerequisites (where applicable)

Zhloe Aliapoh

Idyllshire (X:4.6,Y:6.7)

55

Arms Wide Open - Idyllshire (X:5.8, Y:7.0)

'Go West, Craftsman' quest (mentioned above) and 'A Great New Nation' in Heavensward 's MSQ

M'naago

Rhalgr's Reach (X:14.6, Y:9.4)

60

None Forgotten, None Forsaken - Rhalgr's Reach (X:9.8,Y:12.5)

'Reach Long and Prosper' quest (mentioned above) and 'Return of the Bull' in Stormblood 's MSQ

Kurenai

The Ruby Sea (X:28.3,Y:15.3,Z:-1.2)

62

The Seaweed is Always Greener - Kugane (X:10.1,Y:9.9)

Fulfill Kurenai's personal questline to unlock her as a custom delivery client, starting with 'The Palace of Lost Souls' in The Ruby Sea (X:20.2,Y:20.1).

Also complete 'Arms Wide Open' from Khloe Aliapoh's questline.

Adkiragh

Idyllshire (X:4.8, Y:6.6)

66

Between a Rock and the Hard Place - Idyllshire (X:5.8, Y:7.0)

Completion of the following quests: MSQ titled 'Stormblood', 'Arms Wide Open' from Khloe Aliapoh's questline, and 'Purbol Rain' in the Azim Steppe (X:33.3,Y:27.1)

Kai-Shirr

Eulmore, the Canopy (X:12.2,Y:9.9)

70

Oh, Beehive Yourself - Eulmore (X:11.7,Y:11.7)

Complete the 'Moving Forward' Shadowbringers MSQ and 'The Boutique Always Wins' quest (mentioned above)

Ehll-Tou

The Firmament (X:13.5,Y:11.2)

70

O Crafter, My Crafter - The Firmament (X:14.2,Y:12.7)

Complete the 'Litany of Peace' Heavensward MSQ

Unlock The Firmament in Ishgard via the 'Towards the Firmament' quest, along with the Ishgardian Restoration Main Quests.

Afterward, find Ehll-Tou and complete 'If Songs Had Wings' followed by 'O Crafter, My Crafter'.

Charlemend

The Firmament (X:8.9,Y:8.5)

70

You Can Count On It - The Firmament (X:8.9,Y:8.5)

Complete the following quests: 'Smiles Across the Sky', 'The Brume Lifts', and 'Go West, Craftsman' (mentioned above)

Ameliance

Old Sharlayan (X:15.6,Y:7.2)

80

Of Mothers and Merchants - Old Sharlayan (X:12.6,Y:9.7)

Complete the MSQ titled 'Endwalker' along with the 'Go West, Craftsman' quest (mentioned above)

Anden

Il Mheg (X:16.6, Y:33.8)

80

That's So Anden - The Crystarium (X:9.3,Y:11.3)

Complete the MSQ titled 'Endwalker' along with the 'Go West, Craftsman' quest (mentioned above)

Margrat

Labyrinthos (X:20.4,Y:20.1)

80

A Request of One's Own - Old Sharlayan (X:13.8,Y:15.0)

Complete the Endwalker MSQ titled 'Going Haam' along with the 'Go West, Craftsman' quest (mentioned above)

Nitowikwe

Shaaloani (X:14.3, Y:9.3)

90

Laying New Tracks - Tuliyollal (X:14.1,Y:12.1)

Complete the Dawntrail MSQ titled 'The Warmth of Family' along with the 'Go West, Craftsman' quest (mentioned above)

item.title: All Schedule 1 Cheats and Console Commands
item.description:
There's a ton of fun to be had with Schedule 1 , particularly when using cheats. With console commands, players can completely transform the experience, either by giving themselves an unlimited amount of money and products or by altering the intensity with which law enforcement pursues them.

Although enabling Schedule 1 cheats is relatively straightforward, figuring out how to use one or two of them can be a little tricky. To do so, players will need to know the correct item IDs for the drugs and furniture they want to give themselves, the best of which can be found a little further down the page.

How to Enable Console Commands in Schedule 1

Before players can use Schedule I cheats, they'll first need to enable the console, which they can do from the Settings menu. Under the Game tab, they'll find an option for the Console, which can be toggled on and off via a circular radio button. After enabling cheats, players should exit the Settings menu and then press the tilde key (`) to bring up the console. From there, it's a simple case of typing in one of the Schedule 1 cheats listed below and then hitting enter.

On most keyboards, the tilde key is located beneath the escape key, above tab, and to the left of the number 1.

All Schedule 1 Cheats and Console Commands

Console Command

Description

Example Usage

freecam

Toggles free cam mode

freecam

save

Forces a save

save

settime

Sets the time of day to the specified 24-hour time

settime 1530

give

Gives the player the specified item. Optionally specify a quantity

give ogkush 5

clearinventory

Clears the player's inventory

clearinventory

changecash

Changes the player's cash balance by the specified amount

changecash 5000

changebalance

Changes the player's online balance by the specified amount

changebalance 5000

addxp

Adds the specified amount of experience points

addxp 100

spawnvehicle

Spawns a vehicle at the player's location

spawnvehicle vehicle shitbox

set movespeed

Sets the player's move speed multiplier

setmovespeed 1

setjumpforce

Sets the player's jump force multiplier

setjumpforce 1

teleport

Teleports the player to the specified location

teleport townhall, teleport barn

setowned

Sets the specified property or business as owned

setowned barn, setowned laundromat

packageproduct

Packages the equipped product with the specified packaging

packageproduct jar, packageproduct baggie

setstaminareserve

Sets the player's stamina reserve (default 100) to the specified amount

setstaminareserve 200

raisewanted

Raises the player's wanted level

raisewanted

lowerwanted

Lowers the player's wanted level

lowerwanted

clearwanted

Clears the player's wanted level

clearwanted

sethealth

Sets the player's health to the specified amount

sethealth 100

settimescale

Sets the time scale. Default 1

settimescale 1

setvar

Sets the value of the specified variable

setvar

setqueststate

Sets the state of the specified quest

setqueststate

setquesentrystate

Sets the state of the specified quest entry

setquestentrystate

setemotion

Sets the facial expression of the player's avatar

setemotion cheery

setunlocked

Unlocks the given NPC

setunlock

setrelationship

Sets the relationship scalar of the given NPC. Range is 0-5

setrelationship 5

addemployee

Adds an employee of the specified type to the given property

addemployee botanist barn

setdiscovered

Sets the specified product as discovered

setdiscovered ogkush

growplants

Sets ALL plants in the world fully grown

growplants

setlawintensity

Sets the intensity of law enforcement activity on a scale of 0-10

setlawintensity 6

setquality

Sets the quality of the currently equipped item

setquality standard, setquality heavenly

bind

Binds the given key to the given command

bind t 'settime 1200'

unbind

Removes the given bind

unbind t

clearbinds

Clears ALL binds

clearbinds

hideui

Hides all on-screen UI

hideui

disable

Disables the specified GameObject

disable pp

enable

Enables the specified GameObject

enable pp

endtutorial

Forces the tutorial to end immediately (only if the player is actually in the tutorial)

endtutorial

disablenpcasset

Disabled the given asset under all NPCs

disablenpcasset avatar

showfps

Shows FPS label

showfps

hidefps

Hides FPS label

hidefps

How to Use Console Commands in Schedule 1 (Item ID List)

All of the cheats in Schedule 1 can be useful, but the most important one is arguably Give. With Give, players can get just about any item in the game, from drugs and ingredients to furniture and hardware. To use the Give console command, players should type in the name of the item that they want without any spaces, like give mixingstationmk2 or give cocaine 20 . Item IDs for some of the most useful items and products in Schedule 1 can be found below.

Item IDs for All Schedule 1 Drugs

Drug Name

Item ID

OG Kush

ogkush

Sour Diesel

sourdiesel

Green Crack

greencrack

Granddaddy Purple

granddaddypurple

Methamphetamine

meth

Cocaine

cocaine

Item IDs for the Best Schedule 1 Hardware / Furniture

Item Name

Item ID

Brick Press

brickpress

Cauldron

cauldron

Chemistry Station

chemistrystation

Extra Long-Life Soil

extralonglifesoil

Full Spectrum Grow Light

fullspectrumgrowlight

High-Quality Pseudo

highqualitypseudo

Golden Skateboard

goldenskateboard

Lab Oven

laboven

Mixing Station Mk2

mixingstationmk2

Packaging Station Mk2

packagingstationmk2

item.title: Monopoly GO: City Racers Event Guide
item.description:
Start your engines as the racing minigame is back in Monopoly GO . This time around, it's called City Racers. It starts on April 2 and runs for four days until April 6 .

The City Racers event offers plenty of exciting rewards for participants, including the Wild Sticker. Below, we will share all the rewards available in the City Racers Monopoly GO event and some easy instructions on how to play.

Updated by Umama Ali on Apr 02, 2025: The Prize Drop minigame is over, and now City Racers is back in Monopoly GO. This time, it’s packed with even better rewards, including the Wild Sticker. The top reward includes the Wild Sticker, a five-star sticker pack, the Champ token, and a new emoji. In addition, there are many sticker packs of all rarities up for grabs. Keep reading to find out everything you need to know about the City Racers event.

City Racers Rewards In Monopoly GO

Rank

Team Rewards

Solo Rewards

1

Wild Sticker, Champ Board Token, Emoji, Five-Star Sticker Pack

Four-Star Sticker Pack, Three-Star Sticker Pack, Champ Board Token, Emoji

2

Five-Star Sticker Pack, Four-Star Sticker Pack, Emoji

Three-Star Sticker Pack, Two-Star Sticker Pack, Emoji

3

Four-Star Sticker Pack, Three-Star Sticker Pack, Emoji

Three-Star Sticker Pack

4

Two-Star Sticker Pack, One-Star Sticker Pack

Two-Star Sticker Pack

How to Play City Racers Monopoly GO

To participate in the City Racers mini-game, fans will need an event-exclusive currency: Flag Tokens. The event features a special dice, and you can roll that dice with your flags. Each roll requires 20 Flag Tokens. You have the option to increase your score using your roll multiplier. For example, a 5x multiplier will multiply your score by 5, but it will use up 100 flags.

As mentioned above, you can play this minigame solo, but we recommend teaming up if you want the best rewards. Team rewards include the Wild Sticker and a five-star sticker pack, and solo rewards only offer a four-star and three-star sticker pack. Completing laps in City Racers will also reward you with items like Flag Tokens, stickers, and free dice.

In the City Racers minigame, you've got one day to form your teams, and after that, you’ll be racing daily. There are three races in total, and your rank in each one determines how many points you earn. The third race gives the most points, so a smart strategy is to save your Flag tokens and go all-in for it.

To collect more Flag Tokens, you can complete your Quick Wins tasks, land on them on the board, and complete event and tournament milestones. At the time of writing, the Rush Hour Riches solo event is live in the game. We have a dedicated guide on how to get more Flag Tokens for City Racers that you can check out if you need more help.
